intro: Rousselia impariflora, commonly known as the irregular-flowered rousselia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive leaves, which have an irregularly shaped outline and are often deeply lobed. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals that are pink or purple in color. Rousselia impariflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
